skill.name: skill-from-masters
skill.description: Help users create high-quality skills by discovering and incorporating proven methodologies from domain experts. Use this skill BEFORE skill-creator when users want to create a new skill - it enhances skill-creator by first identifying expert frameworks and best practices to incorporate. Triggers on requests like "help me create a skill for X" or "I want to make a skill that does Y". This skill guides methodology selection, then hands off to skill-creator for the actual skill generation.
skill.summary: Help users create high-quality skills by discovering and incorporating proven methodologies from dom...
skill.author: GBSOSS

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. It provides workflow guidance for helping users create skills using expert methodologies from a static reference database. No network calls, no filesystem access beyond reading the included reference file, no command execution.

content.user_title: Apply Expert Methodologies to Skill Creation
content.value_statement: Users often create skills without leveraging proven frameworks from recognized experts. This skill helps identify and incorporate battle-tested methodologies before generating a new skill, resulting in higher quality, more effective skills.
actual_capabilities: Identifies relevant expert methodologies for any skill domain
Maps user requirements to established frameworks from recognized experts
Presents curated expert sources including books, talks, and documented practices
Guides collaborative selection of 1-3 primary methodologies
Distills actionable principles from selected methodologies
Integrates selected frameworks into the skill creation workflow
limitations: Does not execute code or modify files directly
Requires skill-creator skill for actual skill generation
Cannot access real-time web content for methodology research

use_cases.title: Build Skills with Expert Foundations
use_cases.description: Create skills grounded in proven methodologies from recognized experts across any domain.

use_cases.title: Apply PM Frameworks
use_cases.description: Incorporate frameworks from Marty Cagan, Teresa Torres, or Gibson Biddle into new skills.

use_cases.title: Structure Communication Skills
use_cases.description: Use Pyramid Principle, Amazon 6-Pager, or similar frameworks for communication-focused skills.

prompt_templates.title: Start New Skill
prompt_templates.scenario: Creating a new skill from scratch
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to create a skill for [describe purpose]. Help me discover expert methodologies I should incorporate before we generate it.

prompt_templates.title: Select Framework
prompt_templates.scenario: Choosing methodologies for a specific domain
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the key frameworks from [domain expert name] and how should I apply them when creating a [skill type]?

prompt_templates.title: Combine Approaches
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to combine [framework A] with [framework B] for my [skill name] skill. What are the synergies and conflicts?

prompt_templates.title: Extract Principles
prompt_templates.scenario: Distilling expert wisdom into actionable steps
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me extract the core principles and quality criteria from [expert name]'s methodology for creating a [skill type].

output_examples.input: Help me create a skill for writing product requirement documents
output: Product Management: Marty Cagan emphasizes problem-first PRDs, separating problem space from solution space
Business Writing: Barbara Minto's Pyramid Principle - lead with conclusion, MECE structure
Amazon: Working backwards from press release, 6-pager narrative format
Recommendation: Combine Amazon's narrative format with Cagan's problem-first approach

best_practices: Use this skill BEFORE skill-creator to establish the methodology foundation
Select 1-3 primary methodologies to avoid conflicting instructions
Document methodology sources in generated skills for provenance
anti_patterns: Creating skills without referencing established expert frameworks
Combining more than 3 methodologies that may conflict
Skipping the methodology selection phase entirely

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It provides workflow guidance for the skill-creator skill.

faq.question: What domains are covered in the methodology database?
faq.answer: The database includes frameworks for Writing, Product Management, Sales, Leadership, Engineering, Startups, and Personal Effectiveness.

faq.question: Can I add custom methodologies?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill can search the web for additional experts if the domain is not covered in the built-in database.

faq.question: Is user data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This skill does not access external systems or store data. It only provides guidance based on the included methodology database.

faq.question: How does this skill work with skill-creator?
faq.answer: This skill prepares the methodology foundation. Then hand off to skill-creator which generates the actual skill using the selected frameworks.

faq.question: What makes this better than creating skills from scratch?
faq.answer: Skills built on proven methodologies from recognized experts are more effective. This skill ensures you leverage battle-tested approaches.
